predictions.text: Denmark will publicly confirm it has formally summoned (or demanded an urgent meeting with) the U.S. ambassador in Copenhagen in response to U.S. statements about seizing/controlling Greenland, by 2026-02-28 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmation via an official Danish government/MFA press release, parliamentary statement, or on-record MFA spokesperson quote reported by Reuters/AP/FT/WSJ/Bloomberg stating the U.S. ambassador was summoned or an urgent formal meeting was demanded about Greenland seizure/annexation threats.
monitoring_signals: Danish MFA press releases and spokesperson briefings
Reuters/AP headlines mentioning 'summoned the ambassador' + Greenland
Danish parliament (Folketing) foreign affairs committee statements
predictions.rationale: Public threats involving sovereignty often trigger rapid diplomatic demarches; Denmark has strong incentives to signal resolve while avoiding escalation.

predictions.text: Denmark will announce an additional Arctic/Greenland defense and surveillance funding package totaling at least DKK 10 billion (newly allocated, not previously budgeted), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Danish government budget document, defense ministry announcement, or parliamentary agreement explicitly allocating ≥DKK 10B in incremental funding for Greenland/Arctic capabilities (e.g., patrol ships, drones, radar, basing, satellites), with amounts stated.
monitoring_signals: Danish defense ministry procurement announcements tied to Arctic/Greenland
Budget negotiations and coalition agreements mentioning Greenland/Arctic
NATO/Arctic Council-related Danish policy speeches
predictions.rationale: Heightened sovereignty pressure tends to accelerate visible deterrence and domain-awareness spending; Denmark can act domestically without needing treaty changes.

predictions.text: France’s CNIL (or another French national authority) will publicly open a formal investigation or procedure (e.g., 'mise en demeure' or equivalent) into xAI/Grok specifically referencing AI-generated sexualized deepfakes, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Public CNIL (or relevant French authority) notice naming xAI and referencing deepfakes/sexualized synthetic imagery in the stated grounds, or Reuters/AFP reporting citing the authority and explicitly linking the action to Grok deepfake outputs.
monitoring_signals: CNIL announcements mentioning xAI, Grok, deepfakes
French government/ministerial statements on deepfake enforcement
Major media follow-ups confirming escalation beyond 'review' to formal procedure
predictions.rationale: If harmful outputs persist and complaints accumulate, EU privacy/online safety regulators often escalate from preliminary inquiries to formal procedures within months.

predictions.text: Malaysia’s communications regulator (MCMC) will issue a written compliance directive or formal notice to xAI referencing Grok and requiring specific mitigations for sexualized deepfakes (e.g., blocking prompts, reporting tools, or age-gating), by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: MCMC (or another Malaysian central authority) publishes or is credibly reported (Reuters/Bloomberg/FT/WSJ) to have issued a formal written notice/direction to xAI/Grok requiring concrete safeguards specifically tied to sexualized deepfakes.
monitoring_signals: MCMC press releases mentioning AI platforms or Grok
Parliamentary Q&A or minister statements on AI deepfakes
xAI transparency reports or public statements acknowledging Malaysia requirements
predictions.rationale: Malaysia has shown willingness to issue platform-specific directives; a live investigation increases odds of a concrete compliance order.

predictions.text: At least one major container carrier (Maersk, MSC, CMA CGM, Hapag-Lloyd, or ONE) will publicly announce a suspension/avoidance of Bab el-Mandeb/Red Sea transits for at least 7 consecutive days due to security incidents, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Carrier statement, customer advisory, or Reuters/Bloomberg report citing the carrier confirming it will suspend or reroute away from Red Sea/Bab el-Mandeb for ≥7 consecutive days explicitly due to security incidents/attacks.
monitoring_signals: UKMTO/MSC advisories on incidents near Bab el-Mandeb
Carrier customer advisories and schedule disruption notices
War-risk premium updates for Red Sea transits
predictions.rationale: Red Sea route decisions are highly sensitive to incident frequency; even short clusters of attacks can trigger week-long diversions.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Energy will announce an SPR crude oil release/sale totaling at least 10 million barrels explicitly citing supply disruption or price spikes linked to Venezuela instability, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: DOE press release or Federal Register/DOE notice announcing SPR release/sale ≥10M barrels with a stated rationale referencing Venezuela-related disruption or stabilization of gasoline/crude prices after Venezuela events.
monitoring_signals: White House/DOE statements on fuel prices and supply
DOE SPR tender announcements
Brent/WTI spikes and U.S. gasoline price acceleration
predictions.rationale: An SPR action is politically attractive if retail fuel prices jump; however, operational and policy constraints make it far from certain.

predictions.text: AAA’s U.S. national average retail price for regular gasoline will exceed $4.00/gal on at least one day, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: AAA Daily Fuel Gauge Report shows U.S. national average regular gasoline price > $4.00/gal for any date on or before 2026-06-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: AAA daily national average price trend
Refinery outages and crack spread widening
Brent/WTI level and volatility
predictions.rationale: Geopolitical supply risk plus seasonal demand can push retail prices above salient thresholds, but requires sustained crude/product tightness.

predictions.text: China’s EAST (or another named Chinese fusion device) will be reported by a credible outlet (e.g., Xinhua, CCTV, Nature/Science/PRL press coverage) to have achieved a new sustained high-confinement plasma duration of at least 1,000 seconds, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A primary Chinese state media report (Xinhua/CCTV) or peer-reviewed/major-science-outlet coverage states a Chinese fusion device achieved ≥1,000 seconds of sustained plasma operation (with the device named and duration stated).
monitoring_signals: Chinese Academy/Institute of Plasma Physics announcements
Peer-reviewed publications or conference presentations on EAST milestones
International science press reporting on new duration records
predictions.rationale: China is pushing for headline fusion milestones; however, duration records are technically challenging and reporting may lag or be ambiguous.

predictions.text: A U.S. federal agency will announce a competitive grant/funding program totaling at least $250 million specifically targeting advanced plastics recycling or 'design for degradability' materials (beyond routine formula funding), by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: EPA/DOE/NSF (or comparable U.S. agency) posts a NOFO/FOA or press release launching a program with total available funding ≥$250M explicitly aimed at advanced recycling, polymer upcycling, or degradable plastics design, with amount stated.
monitoring_signals: Grants.gov searches for plastics recycling/upcycling FOAs
EPA/DOE circular economy and materials management announcements
Congressional appropriations language referencing plastics/recycling innovation
predictions.rationale: Public pressure and technology progress can trigger large targeted grant rounds, but scale depends on budget priorities and appropriations.
